title: Error on "return (int) NULL;"
body:
I'm trying to install openTSNE (0.4.4) under OpenBSD (6.8) with pip (21.0.1) Python (3.8.6)

##### Expected behaviour

Should compile & install flawlessly

##### Actual behaviour
Compilation stops on 

```
  cc -pthread -Wno-unused-result -Wsign-compare -Wunreachable-code -DNDEBUG -O2 -pipe -g -fPIC -O2 -pipe -g -O2 -pipe -g -fPIC -I/home/guigui/Python/DataScience/include -I/home/guigui/Python/DataScience/Library/include -I/home/guigui/Python/DataScience/lib/python3.8/site-packages/numpy/core/include -I/home/guigui/Python/DataScience/include -I/usr/local/include/python3.8 -c openTSNE/dependencies/annoy/annoymodule.cc -o build/temp.openbsd-6.8-amd64-3.8/openTSNE/dependencies/annoy/annoymodule.o -std=c++14 -DANNOYLIB_MULTITHREADED_BUILD -O3
  openTSNE/dependencies/annoy/annoymodule.cc:180:12: error: cast from pointer to smaller type 'int' loses information
      return (int) NULL;
             ^~~~~~~~~~
  1 error generated.
  error: command 'cc' failed with exit status 1
  ----------------------------------------
  ERROR: Failed building wheel for openTSNE
```

Such a cast is indeed a bad practice. Code should be changed. Also, in the meantime, less strict compilation options should be selected so that the code compiles and package installs on all target platforms.

##### Steps to reproduce the behavior

`python3 - m pip install openTSNE`
